titles.title: Dǝrsanä Mikaʾel, Homiliary for the feasts of St. Michael / Dǝrsanä Gäbrǝʾel, Homiliary for the feasts of St. Gabriel / Mälkǝʾa Gäbrǝʾel "Image of Gabriel"

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dǝrsanä Mikaʾel, Homiliary for the feasts of St. Michael (fols. 3ra-73vb) I-1) Homily by Timothy (Dämatiwos), Patriarch of Alexandria for the 12th of Ḫǝdar (fols. 3ra-9ra) I-2) Homily by an anonymous author for Taḫśaś (fols. 9ra-14va) I-3) Homily [by Epiphanius, Metropolitan of Cyprus] for Ṭǝrr (fols. 14va-23ra) I-4) Homily by an anonymous author for Yäkkatit (fols. 23ra-25vb) I-5) Homily by [Severus] Patriarch of Antiochia for the 12th of Mäggabit (fols. 25vb-39va) I-6) Homily by [Metropolitan Yoḥannǝs] the Orthodox for Miyazya (fols. 39va-43va) I-7) Homily by Yoḥannǝs, Metropolitan of Ethiopia for Gǝnbot (fols. 43va-45ra) I-8) Homily by [Yoḥannǝs], Metropolitan of ʾAksum [for Säne] (fols. 45ra-50va) I-9) Homily [by Metropolitan Yoḥannǝs] for Ḥamle (fols. 50va-54rb) I-10) Homily by an anonymous author for Näḥase (fols. 54rb-56vb) I-11) Homily by an anonymous author for Mäskäräm (fols. 56vb-58vb) I-12) Homily by an anonymous author for Ṭǝqǝmt (fols. 58vb-62rb) I-13) Miracles of St. Michael: 12 miracles (fols. 62ra-73vb) - Introduction (fol. 62ra-rb) II) Dǝrsanä Gäbrǝʾel, Homiliary for the feasts of St. Gabriel (fols. 75ra-99vb) II-1) Homily (for the 19th of Taḫśaś) (fols. 75ra-83vb) II-2) Miracles of St. Gabriel: 13 miracles (fols. 84ra-99vb), incomplete III) Mälkǝʾa Gäbrǝʾel "Image of Gabriel" (fols. 101ra-102rb)
Additiones 1-2.

donors.donor: The name of the original donor had been erased throughout the Ms. and replaced with those of different persons, like Wäldä Yoḥannǝs (e.g., fols. 3ra, 9ra, 21va, 25vb, 39va, 45ra) or Gäbrä Ḥǝywät (e.g., fols. 13ra, 39vb, 43vb, 62ra). These names had been overwritten with those of (Gäbrä?) Tadewos or (Gäbrä?) Śǝllase, which in turn had been crossed out or erased from fol. 54vb onwards and replaced with that of Wäldä Yodahe (e.g., fols. 61vb, 63ra, 63vb, 64rb, 66rb, 70rb, 89rb, 90ra, 98rb). Wäldä Yodahe is mentioned as the commissioner in Additio 2.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. was probably rebound. The front board is broken and repaired. The leather cover is torn off (only turn-ins are preserved). Fols. 51-102 are affected by water. Holes or tears amended on fols. 32, 57, 80.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (probably re-used), covered with reddish brown tooled leather (now for the most part missing). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 1 tool was used: double line fillet).

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) – V(8/fols. 35r-42v) – VI(8/fols. 43r-50v) – VII(8/fols. 51r-58v) – VIII(8/fols. 59r-66v) – IX(8/fols. 67r-74v) – X(8/fols. 75r-82v) – XI(8/fols. 83r-90v) – XII(8/fols. 91r-98v) – <XIII(5; s.l.: 1, stub after 5/fols. 99r-103v)>.

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: All data are for fol. 101r (quire XIII). Text area II: 16.0 x 18.0 (Width) x (Heigth).
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: fine. Hand b: fine.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: fols. 3ra-99vb (Text I and II). The handwriting is characterized by a fine, rounded script with tendency to left-sloping letters with a few distinctive (but not regular) features: the loops of መ are sometimes (one or both of them) not closed below; letter ወ appears occasionally in open form; some letters have tiny hairlines (e.g., ን, ዕ, የ, ይ, ደ). The handwriting is similar to that of FBM-001, but its quality changes significantly in some parts of the texts (s. fols. 38ra-rb or 58vb-59ra). Hand b: fols. 101ra-4102rb (Text III). The handwriting is characterized by slender, broadly spaced and right sloping letters.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; name of the protagonists; names of the donors; a few lines on the incipit page of all texts; incipits of sections of Texts I-1 and I-2; numbers of sections of Text II-2; the word sälam "salutation"; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

otherdetails.otherdetail:
It cannot be excluded that the Ms. consists of only one production unit. Though having different ruling quire XIII might have been added to the textblock simultaneously with the other quires.
Text II-1 ends with a subscriptio (fol. 83ra l.14-83vb) containing a supplication for the donor, whose name has been erased and replaced with that of different names. It begins with: ወሊተኒ፡ ለነዳይ፡ ገብርኤል፡ ዘአጽሐፍክዋ፡ በንዋይየ፡ ለዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ተዝካረ፡ ለሊቀ፡ መላእክት፡ ገብርኤል፡ ከመ፡ ይኵንክሙ[sic]፡ መርሐ፡ ... The miracles of St. Gabriel are numbered (miracles 1-12).

additional.cont:
Fol. 74ra-rb: ˀArke-hymns for Mikaˀel and Gäbrəˀel (ChRep No. 46).

ˀArke-hymn for St. Michael (fol. 74ra): ሰላም፡ ለከ፡ ሚካኤል፡ መልአከ፡ አድኅኖ፤  ሰ፤ ለነዳይ፡ ዘትትኤየኖ...

ˀArke-hymn for St. Gabriel (fol. 74rb): (ሰላም፡ ለከ፡ ገብርኤል፡) ኀበ፡ ድንግል፡ ተፈናዊ…
additional.det: The ʾarke-hymn for Gäbrǝʾel has been partly erased. Beneath these short hymns both angels are depicted (s. Miniature 1).

additional.cont: Fol. 102rb: Note on commissioning of the writing and excommunication against those who stole the book or scratched out its text.
additional.det: Wäldä Yodahe is mentioned as the commissioner of the book.

extras.extra: - Corrections written over erased words and passages: e.g., fols. 21ra, 26ra, 27va, 43ra, 57vb, 62rb, 92rb, 93ra. - A few erasures marked with thin parallel lines: e.g., fols. 20va, 21vb, 45ra, 84va. - Recent corrections, in pen: e.g., fols. 59vb, 60ra. - Minor note: fol. 74v. - Crude drawings, minor notes and scribbles, by recent hands, in ink, pen and pencil: fols. 1r-2r, 8v, 102v-103v.

miniature.info: Fol. 74r: Archangels St. Michael and St. Gabriel, each holding a sword.
Fol. 100v: Ten human figures (saints?) and a prone figure of the donor.

frames.frame: Fol. 75r (incipit page of Text II): two simple coloured (red and black) ornamental bands; interlaces.
